docs.title: Overview
docs.text: FlyMatic is an drone project that integrates both software and hardware components to enable device to fly. This documentation provides detailed information on the repositories, project architecture and key functionalities.

docs.title: Proto 1
docs.text: Pendulum with 2 motors, self balancing.

docs.title: Proto 2
docs.text: Chassis with 4 proppellers, self stabilizing. To be done in further steps.

docs.title: Software Repositories
docs.text:
• STM32 Firmware Repository: Contains the firmware for the STM32F4 microcontroller, including FreeRTOS and motor control logic.
  • Raspberry Pi Software Repository: Contains the real-time Linux code for sensor data processing and communication.

docs.title: 1. SPI Communication Task
docs.text:
• Function: Reads SPI messages containing requested PWM values from the Raspberry Pi.
  • Priority: High
  • Execution Frequency: 100 Hz

docs.title: 2. PWM Output Task
docs.text:
• Function: Writes PWM signals to the motor driver hardware based on the received SPI messages.
  • Priority: Medium
  • Execution Frequency: 50 Hz

docs.title: Task Synchronization
docs.text: The tasks are synchronized using FreeRTOS semaphores to ensure that PWM adjustments are made in real-time without data conflicts.

docs.title: Bus settings
docs.text: Bus details: - MainUnit is a master of communication. - Motorola mode - first edge of SCK as latching event - low SCK state assummed as idle - 8 bit format of data frame

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The MainUnit is a master for all system logic and control. It's deployed on RPI4B board with OS:

System name : - Linux raspberrypi 6.6.31-rt30-v8+ #1 SMP PREEMPT_RT Hardware name: - aarch64

The OS is patched with PREEMPT_RT - more about here linux_foundation_link. To avoid building kernel from scratch, pre-prepared version was built. GitHub - remusmp/rpi-rt-kernel

The most important feature of the PREEMPT_RT patch, is that it that the scheduler can preemt almost every kernel operation.

As a consequence, the user (time critical) threads can now be treated with the higher priority. In most cases, it allows to achieve 100us time resolution. More about it: linux_doc_link

docs.title: Angle Sensing with MPU-6050 for Spirit Level Application
Introduction
docs.text: This document describes the use of the MPU-6050 sensor for angle measurement, particularly in the context of a spirit level application. The MPU-6050 integrates a 3-axis accelerometer and a 3-axis gyroscope, enabling it to accurately measure the orientation of an object. The standard Euler Angles are used as coordinate system.

docs.title: MPU-6050 Accelerometer Data
docs.text: The MPU-6050 provides acceleration data across three axes (X, Y, Z). These values represent the gravitational force acting on each axis, which can be used to determine the tilt angle.

docs.title: Angle Calculation
docs.text: To calculate the tilt angle, we use the acceleration data provided by the MPU-6050. The angle is derived using the arcsin function, which computes the angle from the ratio of the accelerometer readings to the gravitational constant.

docs.title: Formula for Angle Calculation
docs.text: The angle θ can be calculated as follows: $$ [ \theta = \arcsin\left(\frac{A_x}{\sqrt{A_x^2 + A_y^2 + A_z^2}}\right) ] $$ Where: - Ax: Acceleration along the X-axis - Ay: Acceleration along the Y-axis - Az: Acceleration along the Z-axis

docs.title: Practical Application
docs.text: This angle calculation is crucial for maintaining the balance of the drone and can also be used in applications like a digital spirit level.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This document outlines the control of electric motors that drive the drone's propellers. The motors are controlled using PWM signals, which are modulated to adjust the speed and direction of the propellers.

docs.title: Hardware Components
docs.text:
• Motors: RCX 1806 2400kV (Clockwise and Counterclockwise)
  • Motor Drivers: Brushless ESC 20A 2-3S with a built-in BEC 2A

docs.title: PWM Configuration
docs.text:
• Frequency: 50 Hz
  • Duty Cycle: 5% (1ms) to 10% (2ms) (corresponding to minimum and maximum speed)

docs.title: Relationship Between PWM and Motor Speed
docs.text: The PWM signal's duty cycle directly controls the motor speed. A higher duty cycle increases the speed, while a lower duty cycle decreases it.

docs.title: Practical Implementation
docs.text: The PWM signals are generated by the STM32 microcontroller running FreeRTOS. The values are dynamically adjusted based on inputs from the accelerometer and gyroscope data.

docs.title: Sending power control from master to slave
Frame format
docs.text:
Power requests shall be send in the following frame format through the SPI bus:

0 1 2 3 Power_1 Power_2 Power_3 Power_4

Values are in range of uint8 format:

0 - No power requested on corresponding motor 255 - maximum power requested on corresponding motor

Bytes are sent in ascending order (Power_1 to Power_4)

docs.title: Period of sending
docs.text: Frames shall be sent from MainUnit to AuxUnit cyclicaly with 10ms period. MainUnit shall be a master of communication.
